title: C-MCTS: Safe Planning with Monte Carlo Tree Search. (arXiv:2305.16209v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: The Constrained Markov Decision Process (CMDP) formulation allows to solve safety-critical decision making tasks that are subject to constraints. While CMDPs have been extensively studied in the Reinforcement Learning literature, little attention has been given to sampling-based planning algorithms such as MCTS for solving them. Previous approaches perform conservatively with respect to costs as they avoid constraint violations by using Monte Carlo cost estimates that suffer from high variance. We propose Constrained MCTS (C-MCTS), which estimates cost using a safety critic that is trained with Temporal Difference learning in an offline phase prior to agent deployment. The critic limits exploration by pruning unsafe trajectories within MCTS during deployment. C-MCTS satisfies cost constraints but operates closer to the constraint boundary, achieving higher rewards than previous work. tldr: C-MCTS 提出了一种解决有约束的决策问题的方法，通过训练安全评判器进行成本估计，并在部署期间通过剪枝不安全轨迹来限制探索，实现了更高的奖励和更高效的规划步骤。
en_tdlr: C-MCTS proposes a method for solving constrained decision-making problems, which trains a safety critic for cost estimation and prunes unsafe trajectories to achieve higher rewards and more efficient planning steps.
